revision.text: {|{{Infobox Aircraft Begin |name = SIAI S.8 |image = SIAI S.8.jpg |caption = }}{{Infobox Aircraft Type |type = reconnaissance flying-boat |manufacturer = [[SIAI-Marchetti|SIAI]] |designer = [[Raffaele Conflenti]] |first flight =[[1917 in aviation|1917]] |introduced = |retired = |status = |primary user = [[Regia Marina]] |more users = |produced = |number built = 214 |unit cost = |developed from = |variants with their own articles = }} |} The '''SIAI S.8''' was an [[Italy|Italian]] 1910s two-seat reconnaissance flying-boat. ==Design and development== The [[SIAI-Marchetti|Societa Idrovolanti Alta Italia]] (SIAI) was formed in 1915 initially to build [[France|French]] flying-boats under license. The company employed Rafaele Conflenti as Chief Designer and his first design was the '''SIAI S.8''' a two-seat equal-span biplane flying boat first flown in 1917. The [[Regia Marina|Royal Italian Navy]] ordered 800 S.8s to be built by SIAI and sub-contractors. With the end of the [[First World War|war]] production was stopped when 172 aircraft had been delivered. Early aircraft were powered by an Isotta Fraschini V4B engine, later aircraft had the more powerful 220 hp (164 kW) Hispano-Suiza 44. ==Operational history== The aircraft equipped five squadrons of the Regia Marina. By 1920 only 63 aircraft survived mostly in storage. ==Operators== ;{{flag|Kingdom of Italy}} *[[Regia Marina]] ==Specifications (S.8) == {{aircraft specifications |plane or copter?=plane |jet or prop?=prop |crew=2 |capacity= |length main= 32 ft {{frac|3|1|2}} in |length alt= 9.84 m |span main= 41 ft {{frac|10|3|4}} in |span alt= 12.77 m |height main= 10ft 10 in |height alt= 3.30 m |area main= 495.16 ft2 |area alt= 46.00 m2 |airfoil= |empty weight main= 1,984 lb |empty weight alt= 900 kg |loaded weight main= |loaded weight alt= |useful load main= |useful load alt= |max takeoff weight main= 3,031 lb |max takeoff weight alt= 1375 kg |engine (prop)=[[Isotta-Fraschini V.4]]B |type of prop=inline piston |number of props=1 |power main= 180 hp |power alt= 134 kW |max speed main= 89 mph |max speed alt= 144 km/h |cruise speed main= |cruise speed alt= |never exceed speed main= |never exceed speed alt= |stall speed main= |stall speed alt= |range main= 435 miles |range alt= 700 km |ceiling main= 19,865 ft |ceiling alt=6000 m |climb rate main= |climb rate alt= |loading main= |loading alt= |more performance= |armament= one 7.7mm (0.303 in) machine gun in bow cockpit, up to 265 lb (120 kg) of bombs. }} ==See also== {{aircontent| |related= |similar aircraft= |sequence= |lists= * [[List of seaplanes and flying boats]] |see also= }} ==References== {{commons category|SIAI S.8}} {{Reflist}} *{{cite book |last= |first= |authorlink= |coauthors= |title= The Illustrated Encyclopedia of Aircraft (Part Work 1982-1985)|year= |publisher= Orbis Publishing|location= |issn=}} {{Savoia-Marchetti aircraft}} [[Category:Italian military reconnaissance aircraft 1910â€“1919]] [[Category:Savoia-Marchetti aircraft|S.08]] [[Category:Flying boats]] [[Category:Military aircraft of World War I]] [[Category:Biplanes]] [[Category:Single-engined pusher aircraft]]
